definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms

sentences.english: QuXiao gauze think must find local extortionate do middleman, both sides make peace.
sentences.chinese: 曲筱绡认为必须找当地的地头蛇做中间人，双方讲和。

sentences.english: The company finally realizes that their network is suffering a man-in-the-middle attack.
sentences.chinese: 公司最后发现，他们的网络正在遭受中间人攻击。

sentences.english: We approach the retailer direct, without any middle-man.
sentences.chinese: 我们直接同零件商接触，不经任何中间人。

sentences.english: The business was arranged through a trust worthy go-between.
sentences.chinese: 这笔生意是由一位值得信赖的中间人安排的。

sentences.english: They are exploited by intermediaries , hitch hiker sand other parasites .
sentences.chinese: 他们利用中间人顺山砂等寄生虫。

sentences.english: He was named as a go-between in the aftermath of the Bank Century bailout.
sentences.chinese: 他被称为世纪银行援助案的中间人。

sentences.english: According to one report, the middleman was the wife of the Brazilian ambassador.
sentences.chinese: 据一个报道说，中间人是巴西大使的妻子。

sentences.english: Man-in-the-middle attack is used wildly in a network attacking.
sentences.chinese: 中间人攻击是网络攻击的重要手段之一。

sentences.english: There are no intermediaries Between God and the worshipper .
sentences.chinese: 穆斯林与真主之间没有中间人。

sentences.english: That highlights the role of “information intermediaries”.
sentences.chinese: 这就突出了“信息中间人”的角色。

sentences.english: The Internet Economy promised to get rid of the middle-men and we loved it.
sentences.chinese: 互联网经济允诺要取缔中间人，我们都拥护这一点。

sentences.english: It can often help prevent ARP-based Man-in-the-Middle attacks.
sentences.chinese: 这种技术常常用于帮助防御基于ARP的中间人攻击。

sentences.english: The seller had given the middleman thirty kilogrammes of copper as the fee.
sentences.chinese: 卖者给予中间人红色铜二钧作为回报。

sentences.english: Many people still want go- betweens of this sort.
sentences.chinese: 许多人仍然需要这样的中间人。
他们中的三个是中间人。
他们中的三个是中间人。

definition: to pull strings/to manipulate (a puppet)/to control from behind the scene/to mediate
to bring together/to mediate/to arrange a deal
to appear personally/to step in/to step forth/to show up
to reconcile/to mediate/to bring warring parties to agreement/to arbitrate
(old) itinerant political adviser/(fig.) lobbyist/go-between/mouthpiece/also pr. [shuo1 ke4]
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
